title.narrative: Distribution of Livestock Feed to Drought Affected Communities of Northern and Southern Red Sea Regions

description.narrative: The key objective of the project is to safeguard the food security and livelihoods of the most vulnerable groups in the most drought-affected areas of the country. The project includes procurement and distribution of high fiber ranch pellets, as supplementary animal feed for livestock and refresher sessions on feed management for the agricultural extension workers who will be providing the frontline distribution. The project provides humanitarian assistance to 92,650 people, including 24,460 women, 14,639 men, 53,552 children, and 4,355 persons with disabilities.

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Pastoralists and agro-pastoralists in Northern and Southern Red Sea regions are provided with supplementary animal feed.
